intro: Anechites asperuginis, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Anechites asperuginis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
